Historically, this early method of producing more energy from nuclear fusion than it took to bring the fusion device to fusion conditions actually worked the very first time it was tried - fission-fusion technology actually never failed to work. The deuterium in sea water is capable of completely powering planet earth at a the current level of 17 Terawatts for 29.4 billion years. Deuterium-Tritium fusion fuel is however much easier to ignite and requires a less powerful and costly fusion driver to initiate.
